text: today there are many animals that can
give us insights into the inner workings
of our ancestors a field mouse helps in
understanding the functions of the
cerebral neocortex we can trace its
reactions to a sudden sound the sound
activates the auditory area of the
cerebral neocortex we can see the brain
pattern at the time the mouse hears the
sound at that moment the area turns red
activated neural cells then analyze the
sound and the processed information
allows the mouse to quickly make its
move the cerebral neocortex was
essential for mammals to survive at
night one of the most important factor
for mammals to develop larger brain is
mammals have a new structure called
neocortex by developing this neocortex
structure than made up the cerebral
Hemisphere you are able to accommodate
more neurons in your brain to integrate
the information to differentiate the
information much better if you compare a
early and primitive mammal form such as
Attalla Basilius to a very derived and a
very advanced mammal you will realize
that a major difference is really in the
advanced mammals they developed this new
poor text in the brain so the brain
volume has also become much much
